text:
With TomCat 33m2 after a session expires the attributes which implements the 
HttpSessionBindingListener the unbound is called.
With TomCat33m4 and later (b1,b2) this doesn't happen anymore!

As far as I see it should be implemented in the HttpSessionFacade.invalidate 
Method (the javadoc say it should call unbound on the attributes but it dosn't).

So does we have a Memory Leak here, too?
creator: michael@x-cellent.com
cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
Can't reproduce with the recent build, and I think it should be fixed in the
latest released build ( I fixed that recently ). If you still have this problem
with the current nightly please reopen the bug and provide more details.

creator: michael@x-cellent.com
text:
I have tried the Nightly Build from 2001-09-16.
And I really get an unbound  :-)

BUT:
we produced an exception in our unbound method, which we will fix now.
This will have a side effect to tomcat so that the session handling doesn't 
seems to work after that at all!

creator: nacho@apache.org
text: Fixed in CVS, check it ASAP, please..
